betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Look, when you get up in the morning sometimes you just.. have to get some wood. So get out there and punch a tree my young apprentice, you still have much to learn

§4Information: 
This quest is simply to get you used to the various mechanics that exist within the book including retrieval quest, crafting quest, and the like. This quest will begin you on the path to all others!

I know to a bright young student like yourself journeying into the world must seem very simple, but there are still yet task to compelte, use the wood you have gathered in order to build a few tools hmm?

§4Information:
Again admittedly not very difficult; however, this quest is supposed to illustrate the crafting mechanic of the book rather then simply the gathering requirement.

Cobblestone is a simple enough material, use your newly made wooden pickaxe to turn stone into cobble! This simple task should be nothing for you my young apprentice

§4Information:
This quest is to help you familiarize yourself with the "Choice" quest reward system, which will also be used throughout the pack.

Alright, so maybe you don't know /all/ the tricks of the world do you? Haven't seen how to simplify some sheers, well here is your chance! 

§4Information: 
This quest is to help you on understanding that this is more then just vanilla with a gentle introduction to a handy tool. In this case the concept of having a set of shears for sheeps or other similar task early on, or earlier then when the player might have iron.

Perhaps you could make use of those shears you just crafted to find a sheep, or perhaps you could plant that gift of cotton to make the components required. Either way you should learn to make a bedroll

§4Information: 
A bed roll effectively gives you a mobile bed so that you can travel yet still not have to worry about the night time being as much of a hassle.
You may always ask questions apprentice, but it is best to learn from a master. Quickly make yourself a stone pickaxe

Sometimes a little heat is all one needs, so use the cobble you have gathered to make a furnace!

§4Information: 
Again fairly straightforward, though it is worth noting that we introduce bread as a reward, but the fact is this is one of the recipies which has been altered, in this case it has been altered by Pam's harvestcraft, so perhaps it's best to treasure this one at least for now, until we teach you how to make bread

Having a furnace is nice and all, but what's the point if there's nothing to burn in it, quickly use your pick axe and mine up some coal from a nearby mountain or hillside! 

§4Information: 
This quest is intended to help introduce you to the concept of multi step quest or quest that have more then one simple objective. In this case your objective will be to first get coal AND THEN to also make a torch. These quest will be marked with [Multipart] in the title

Take your knowledge of furnaces, the heat of coal, and this powerful new substance and melt it all down into a useable form for me would you? 

§4§4Information:
This is the point where in general you should start seeing more and ore materials showing up from a variety of mods that alter and change the world. It is my hope that you're starting to really get into the very start of some of the mods by this point.

My young apprentice, you may notice down by the water that there is... a curious matter. Please pick me up some reed 

§4Information: 
Reed is the basis of nearly all of the quest below because it allows you to make paper. This quest is critical in nearly all of the quest lines to open all the mods that are present.

Now you may simply view yourself as my glorified apprentice, but I promise you there is much more! Quickly make a bit of paper with that reed! 

§4Information: 
Much like the quest gathering reed, this quest is purely to get the player down the path towards making books. This should be pretty par for the course for any regular minecraft player.

Or rather it will be full of holes, please take a bit of time to practice on the local bovines, we must... increase your skill

§4Information: 
Cows have changed a bit, with Animania installed, almost all of the animals in the pack have some unique quirks and Cows are no different. You can learn more about Animania by purusing the Farming and Agricultural Quest lines. Be warned a bull will fight back.

This land is strange and filled with horrors, there may be times that you have no choice but to fight, it is best not to do so without a powerful weapon

§4Information: 
Combat does have a place in this modpack, in fact in order to get started in a few of the mods you're going to need to fight. This will start you down the path towards the Embers mod.

You've learned to kill cows for their skin, turn reed into paper, it's time to write this all down somewhere!

§4Information:
This is your first book, and will begin virtually all all of the mod related quest lines. Thamucraft is one of the first and most obvious.

It would seem that this iron can be broken down a bit.. quickly apprentice I have an idea! 

§4Information: 
The Iron Nugget didn't used to be a thing in the minecraft, but it is one of the key ingredients for the Almanac which is the guide book to the Rustic Mod. To craft nuggets you can simply put an ingot in your crafting square. Note also that you will be able to use a compacting drawer (later on)

My young apprentice we can't simply destroy life we must rebuild as well, collect some saplings from the tree you fell!

§4Information: 
Any tree sapling should work for this, even the sapling from the first tree that you manage to fel. This is a simple quest but it's intended to guide you down the path to a number of mods including Botania, Astral Sorcery, and Animania.

The very life of the earth around us can often offer clues, let the flowers of the garden and I guide you

§4Information: 
This is the Botania Book, Botania in many ways is a mod that is based around using flowers and a sort of druidic magic. It will explore everything from new armor and weapons to interesting devices to more fine tune Redstone.

Hmm... it's time to learn the art of getting drunk off your butt, let me guide you in that process

§4Information: 
Rustic is a mod that focuses on a bit of alchemy, and brewing. Outside of Pam's harvestcraft this is probably one of the most farm oriented mod's in place. This also introduces a number of trees and slate to the underground areas.

This land is run amok with terrible creatures, please smite our foes so that our camp may be safe, it is difficult to train you with all the moaning. 

§4Information: 
Zombies are miserable, but they are also a key ingredient in a number of things, including the Abyssalcraft guide book. So you're going to need to kill at least a few to get started on this journey.

I do not like this apprentice, this is a dark path from which I am not sure if there is truely a return... be careful

§4Information: 
Abyssalcraft can offer the player MANY Challenges, with a variety of monsters, biomes, dimensions, and even bosses, there is almost no end to the horrors which await you at the end of this mod. It also offers and interesting form of transmutation like alchemy

Apprentice I do believe we've hit a... gold mine with this iron stuff. Make a pick axe with the metal... I have a theory~ 

§4Information
Iron Pickaxes are the very core of the end game progression for vanilla minecraft, but it represents the early stage of most of the other more popular mod packs. This will allow you to mine redstone, diamond and more .

There are some shimmering crystals over there apprentice perhaps they could offer us some... insight hmm? 

§4Information: 
This is the starting quest for Thaumcraft, Crystals are Thaumcraft 6 version of aspected vis (in a great many ways), and you'll want to collect a fair number. When you mine your first crystal you'll receive a notification that you should sleep. Doing so SHOULD provide you with the book "Strange Dreams"

Rumor has it my apprentice, that among the sandy beaches you can find a shining blue gem is it a diamond?

§4Information: 
Aquamarine's can usually be found in the sandy shores near oceans and rivers, not too unlike clay. This is a key component of the astral socery mod. In addition if by some means you already have Lava and a bucket of starlight the collision of those two occasionally results in an aquamarine.

My apprentice this is no diamond that is for sure, but perhaps it has some other properties we can invetigate!

§7§6NOTE: 
You do not need a luminous crafting table, this can be crafted on a regular table 

§3§4Information: 
This is another and key step to completing the book that astral socery uses. the recipie is fairly simple with aquarmines and normal paper. Beyond the book itself there's not too many instances where parchment gets used early game, so you shouldn't need a ton.

Oh my young apprentice, you have much to learn, join me in the study of Astoronomy and I shall show you the stars!

§4Information: 
This is the actual astral sorcery book. I should point out that this book will have it's own internal quest line where the various components are unlocked as you progressively make bigger alters. I will try to walk you through all the various other components.

Hmm... well it's not the fabled diamond we've all heard about but there may be a powerful dust we should investigate, dig deep my apprentice

§4Information: 
Redstone is key to Thaumcraft, and largely it will be the key ingredient that allows you to start exploring that mod in more detail (it's required in one of the early steps).

So best not to ask questions on where I got that lamp, but without a switch there's not much point is there? here turn it on real quick

§4Information: 
It may seem odd to be stepping back in terms of ingredients needed for crafting, but without Iron and Coal Immersive engineering is virtually unplayable anyway. In that vein ,this is by and large the starting quest for Immersive Engineering.

Power is at the very heart of the equation and I will show you the path to achiveing it

§4Information: 
Immersive information is a mod which focuses on a sort of post industrial sort of lifestyle. A wide variety of items, tools, and processes to help not only automate but build a more electrified world. This is largely one of the only "Tech" mods within the pack.

You should probably sleep after collecting all those crystals, and then... maybe your dreams will lead you to the answer? Though you'll probably want to sleep somewhere comfertable, like a real bed!

§4Information: 
The book should provide you with the general recipie for Salis Mundis. This isn't made through alchemy in Thaumcraft as with previous versions, instead it is one of the first things which you craft.

Apprentice, the room simply doesn't look nice, perhaps we could add a nice bookshelf? 

§3§4Information: 
This quest is a combination of things, one it's supposed to assist the player and start to open up additional chapters later on down the road having to do with enchanting. Beyond that, this is also a quest that's key towards opening up Thaumcraft.

What if we just burn a book? Let's find out

§4Information: 
With the inclusion of Pam's harvestcraft and so many other cooking mods, it can be very difficult to oragnize your food. This mod sets out to help alleviate those issues and will take you down the cooking for blockheads quest line.

The key to magic is to know it's there, the Salis Mundis is just the start, open your eyes my apprentice and see the world 

§4Information: 
Much like previous incarnations of the mod, this mod starts by using your "magic" on a bookshelf. In this case you simply right click with your Salis Mundis on a bookshelf and it should transform into a book. Thaumcraft is a heavy magic mod that has principals of risk and reward. 

If too much magic is used it could damage the surrounding enviroment in the form of flux.

Apprentice! Please aid me, a large golem is attacking, if we do not kill it surely we will all perish!

§4Information: 
Be warned, the Golems are not affected by sunlight as they are not undead. They have a strong ranged attack and getting close is just as lethal. They are a formidable opponent that won't be easy to take down. This is the starting quest in the Embers Questline

That golem dropped some powerful items apprentice, we must use them to forge our own fires at the very heart of the world

§4Information: 
The whole concept of embers is that of a Dwarven technology mod, in which the fuel for the core of the modpack is mined up from bedrock itself, trying to encourage the player to establish a presence at the bedrock level.

Well it doesn't talk, but I believe there may be a use, quickly start punching up a few seeds and see if something interesting doesn't pop up
§4
§4Information: 
§4This is the starting quest for the Root's mod. This path will help you progress through the mod so that you can learn more about it and the things it can do.

In the start of any humble adventure we must first learn to use the tools of the world. Here you will learn how to craft not quite a sword, but a knife, which can be used for more delicate operations! 

§4Information: 
Crafting the knife itself is fairly simple, simply a stick and some iron ingots. To use the knife you simply right click an object with it.

Apprentice the world is often filled with a powerful and ancient magic, if you know which flowers to groww~

§4Information: 
The long awaited "Roots 3" this mod has a focus on the nature of druidism itself! It's a great way to interact with nature

My young apprentice, it is time now. Prepare yourself to face the most powerful beast that you can imagine. And you reward will be unmatched in all the realm. Be careful my young apprentice. 

§4Information: No time like the present eh old boy? If you've never assembled a wither before it's fairly simple. You just need 3 wither skulls, 4 Soul Sand, and a go get em attitude. Good luck~

My apprentice, at the very depths of the nether, their exist a creature so altered by demonic influence of it's surroundings that the once glistening pearl white bone structure has been altered and changed into a more... dangerous form

§4Information: This will begin the last series of quest as they relate to the vanilla Minecraft experience. Simply kill a wither skeleton and take it's head.
Finally, the very key to which we can forge our new empire apprentice! It's time to truely learn the mastery of this strange square world

You can feel the very essance of the air brimming with magic. Using a combination of your wide assortment of books and your delightful new shiny rocks, you can channel that power into a tool or even a book!
Alright, so you have these blue shiny rocks, and that's nice and all, but if you're giong to become an expert mage, you're going to need to make use of these right?
My young apprentice, there are dark and powerful magics in this stone, it is best to collect as much as you can, perhaps the new pickaxe you just created can assist you?

Using the obisidian you collected, perhaps if you assemble it in a ring, like a gateway of sorts, and add... a bit of energy like a fire! You might be able to open a portal! You should explore and find the creatures on the other side apprentice!
So if you plunder deep enough into this new land behind the obsidian portal, you might just come across some of the intereting flora, collect one for me!
Alright, so you aren't going to be turning anything into gold, but we might just be working on the keys to giving you a bit of strength no?

Apprentice, time and space can be quite confusing, but let's consult with the local endermen... well not so local. In fact if you manage to take one's eyes... yes lets call them eyes you will find that you can bend both to your will 

§4Information: 
Ender pearls are used for a NUMBER of late game items, we're introducing the concept of killing them early because they are huntable while you're early in the overworld and they have a number of uses.

Listen, you're going to collect a LOT of garbage on this adventure, that much I can pretty much garuntee you. So you're going to need a place to put it all right? 

§4Information: 
This quest is the beginning of a series of organizational and storage driven quest that primarily show up in other chapters of the book. This will include the backpacks, storage drawers, and the like!
Sometimes a chest is nice, but what if you could dedicate your storage to single items or even a select number of them?
Sometimes you need more stroage then what is simply at your base of operations, sometimes you need that storage to be mobile! Introducing the solution just for that!
Sometimes blocks can be broken down, or even reassmebled, it's time to create a device that automates this process for you, don't you agree?

You've developed your new storage drawer's but how much effort have you put into actually sorting things? Don't you wish you had something that could do that for you? Well... do I have some good news for you.
Alright, so admittedly, that backpack isn't quite big enough to really carry anything of use, but I assure you that we can upgrade it, make it stronger, better... not so much faster?

Well perhaps doo... my young aprpenctice many of the natural magics will require quite a bit of work towards farming. In this respect it's best if you know what your'e getting into? Let's start simple! construct a hoe 

§4Information: 
This should be a relatively simple quest, the objective of which is to construct a wooden hoe. This will begin you down the path of a number of more advanced mods in the modpack including Astral Sorcery and Animania.

Sometimes farming is about more then simply planting a crop in the ground, often times you need a bit of... fruity adventure. use your magical crafting abilities to create an apple sapling... you should have some apples right?

In order to truely understand the stars, you must first understand the tools to tamper them with. Using the essance of a slain enderman and the purest of marble construct a tool for such a task 

§4Information: Constructing this is simple enough, but note you need to place a crafting bench near an already existing temple with a crystal, close enough that a little beam of light reaches out to it. You will then be able to craft this wand. 

At night when you are holding this wand you may notice little jets of white light. Those are markers for "Rock Crystals" which you will find of use shortly
To start our journey I predict we will need a flower to assist, collect one of the white ones, they seem to give off a particular radiance
Alright, so agiculture is admittedly a bit more complex then we first described. There's not only making and finding new plants but also figuring out what to do with them. Let's start simple hmm?

It's time to really expand your horizons and start to learn about all the foods you can make and consume! But to do that you might need a bit of help, collect for a bee would you? But not of the southern variety, too twangy

Sometimes we must admit to yourselves that it takes more then simply collecting goods, Combine your knowledge of tools with your knowledge of the world to start making devices to help you handle the foody goods of the world.

Admittedly there are times when the world is not as easy to work with, it is during these times that we must admit perhaps a little help is in order? Create some bait and then place it in a trap for me would you?
Alright so you may have noticed that you need to spice up your foods or else everyone will throw them out? Well I can show you just the trick, but first we're going to need some wool yeah?
Despite all your hard work, sometimes you simply can't find what you're looking for. In that cast it's time to trade in those emeralds for something a bit more useful no?
Sometimes when you're in a hurry or simply looking to set the dinner table, a simple torch won't suffice. In those conditions perhaps it is best to turn that wax you're making into something useful?

Travel my young apprentice and find one of the ancient temples, inside a powerful crystal will shine down upon the crafting table you place near to assist you! 

§4Information: Again, this must be constructed on the table that is near the crystal in the temple. 

These tables have some unqiue properties, a sort of energy bar. The simple explanation is that the closer you are to maximum height and the later in the night that it is, the strong the bar. Note you don't have to be at max height for this table to function.

Now that you have access to the power of the stars, it is important to make use of it, you may psend some time searching for the crystaline rocks that are key to this recipie, but I assure you it is well worth the wait.

§4Information: The lightwell, much like practically everything else in the mod will need access to the night sky in order to function. You can use it to create Starlight which in turn can react with different liquids (like Lava and Water). For  instance, Lava and Starlight will produce sand.

Alright so you've probably figured out those flowers have a bit of magic to them right? Well if you throw them and some seeds into this little creation here you might find they grow even more magical yeah?
The keys of this magic stem from this single flower, learn to cultivate these and you will be on a path to botanical enlightenment!

There is... apprentice a magic I hesitate to speak of, but to understand it all you must know this too... craft a snare

§4Information: 
The Opening quest to Blood magic, these are fairly simple to craft and are used almost like a boala. The next quest will cover how you go about using them.

Use the snare you have created and use it against an enemy, you may find if you slay that beast it will drop it's very essance. This will be our key. 

§4Information: 
You're going to want to use the snares a bit like a Bola, simply throwing them at the mob of your choice, they may or may not get a special graphical effect to signify they have been hit. Once this is done simply kill the mob.

Welp, first perhaps, let's actually you know... craft some uh... instructions? 

§4Information: 
Blood magic is a mod that focuses on the concept of sacrificing blood (be it yours or anything elses really) to an alter. This mod has a large variety of tools, magic, and alchemy as a result and is one of the quintessential magic mods.

There is magic in song and dance as well my apprentice, and understanding that is no less key! 

§4Information
Totemic is a silghtly smaller mod that has a lot of basis off of popular perception around the Native American populations. 

NOTE: For the purposes of balance, totemic largely requires that other quest lines be completed first. As such it's key tool will require adventuring into roots, embers, and more.
All of engineering is born in the heart of the deepst fires, and this is no different, you're going to need a material to contain this fire though
You may find that by placing coal in a lovely 3x3 structure of coke bricks after you whack it with... oh gods wait you need~
My young apprentice you may find if you dip the oil byproduct from your coal coke on some wood that it might come out with a useful sort of sheen to it!

Well no my young apprentice don't actually go to the nether, but you will need a strong material, like a binding. Search the grasess and see if some doesn't drop out

§4Information: 
Hemp is a key ingrendient for a number of cloth based products in the immersive engineering mod and allows the user to go on to construct things like better windmill blades. Beyond all that hemp seeds grow relatively quickly and can be used for a number of other things.
You may have noticed that some crops take a bit of extra effor to grow. Perhaps you can invest in a more... effecient method for growing them?
Sometimes a simple metal will not do, and in cases like those it's best to explore your options! Apprentice it's time to use a bit of sandstone and brick
You'll need to eventure to the nether my young apprentice, but I assure you the rewards are well worth the journey!
You think you may be able to channel the natural energies of the world through a conduit of living wood and gold, using a single petal as a focal point, this may be a good starting point.
There's no point in trying to gather all this energy if you've got nowhere to put it my foolish apprentice! Quickly craft a small pool to gather it in.
By infusing a few different colored botantical petals you can invoke certain plants powers, create a plant that will feed off the fuels of the land my apprentice
You're going to need a way to direct all this mana driven traffic, for that... you're going to need your focusing stick!

Admittedly not quite as good and nowhere near as illegal as crystal meth, but still quite the trip. Use your newly minted wand and travel at night to pick up the places it may hide (hint, it's deep underground)
Sometimes to make some wine, you have to crush a few grapes. Now throw some grapes in this basin and start jumping.
In order to truely work with the bloody source of all life's  essance we must also be willing to forge from it a forge with which to make use of the souls! Craft an appropriate structure for this.
By combining Gunpowder, Redstone, Coal, and bonemeal it may be possible to create a sort of... ritual circle. Use it to draw mystical writings into the ground.
Admittely the wills of the damned can be difficult to try and capture with smiple nets, perhaps a more... attuned weapon would be better.

While you may have constructued your alter, what good will it do you if you don't know how much blood is in it? It's time to combine a bit of redstone, a blank slate, and those arcane symbols you put upon the ground!
To truely start down this path, you must offer some of yourself, create a weapon suitable for taking form yourself a bit of life essance.
Submerge a diamond in your life essance and you may just find the key to starting to make use of all this power you are gathering!
Admittedly I've been giving you a few of these, but perhaps it's best if you learn to make a few of your own?

betterquesting:10.name:8: Starting to Put it all together
betterquesting:10.desc:8: While this simple alter may work for simple task, let's be real with each other... we're going to need more... blood
The blood alter is... doing it's job a bit slow. Perhaps we can... speed it up a bit?
It is time for you to use the souls you've gathered and perhaps put them in a more convienent location no?
having the souls of the fallen trapped in a tiny gem is cool and all... but what if we could make it cooler or hotter?.

betterquesting:10.name:8: This hand of mine is glowing red
betterquesting:10.desc:8: It's loud roar tells me to craft victory, my love, my anger, and all of my blood!
It's time to start forging ahead my apprentice, begin by creating something to help guide you in expanding your bloody mess
Alright, now it's time to make use of that knife, construct a device to contain your very life essance would you my apprentice? Don't worry it will only hurt a little!

Sometimes simply knowing which direction is which doesn't help, sometimes you want to know where a jungle is... well I know just the tool. 

§4Information: 
Nature's compass is a standalone mod designed to help the player find the Biome of choice. The player simply clicks to select the compass and then chooses the biome they wish to find. The compass will not only point to the nearest one but also provide you a distance.

Having dark places is never fun, but now you can use the literal essance of the stars to keep things well lit! 

§4Information: This can be used in a few ways, though of course the most obvious use is to make a much prettier version of the torch. As a heads up, these are difficult to remove without a wand later in the mod, otherwise you just need to put a block where they were.

Lighting up a small area is cute... but what if you could illuminate everything beneath you. Use your luminous alter to craft a device to do just that! 

§4Information: This is fairly simple, as long as this block can see the sky above it, it will start filling the areas below where light can not normally reach (Red X's with F7) and begin populating them with light. This has a rather large range and so can deal with caves for a great distance.

At the very core of extension into the stars is the knowledge of how to distill it. Place an appropriate gem (Aquamarine or Rock Crystal) over the recently created tub to watch the magic work

§4Information: Like any liquid, it's worth noting that you can use both rock crytals and aquamarines in the lightwell to produce this. You can also use Arcane Archives Quartz crystals.

The stars are a magestic place, but perhaps you could use the knowledge from the scrolls around the land to dicern more of their power

§5§4Information: This is IMPORTANT, you need to actually use the constellations in order to infuse and empower a great many things in this mod. So  you may wish to spend a bit of time at night hunting for stars.
There are all number of items that seem to be pourus enough to interact well with mana, throw a few in the mana pool!
Having your mana in one location is fine and all, but perhaps we can expand our powers! Quickly my apprentice, craft a mana tablet.
Using some of that Living wood and the mana infused Iron I believe we might be able to craft some tools and armor, expiriment!
Listen... I'm gonna let you in on a little secret, booze can make things better. Find some ironberries in the world
Listen, sometimes having a bit of water just isn't really convient, that's all I'm saying. In cases like those it's best to have a bit of fertilized soil!
Booze is nice, but what if you could make use of the the herbs of the world for simple things? Well now's your chance to expiriment!
There's some more kitchenware out there... maybe you should make the rest
One of the world's most pervasive forms of natural flowing energy is in the very air around us, we simply need a way to "Catch" it
Forged from Iron in the blast furnace, steel is the basic buliding block of a true engineer, Pay close attention apprentice this can be quite useful!
Learning to harness the motion of the nature, we are able to convert it into a form of... energy, even water can aid us!
While the simple wooden structure is... alright for catchign wind, I can't think that there might be a better way, perhaps...
There's all mater of strange new metal's in this world apprentice, with a variety of uses! Use a bit and play around with it!
The first and most basic form of energy is kinetic, the ability to move from point a to point b (plus or minus some friction) let us utelize this
It's fantastic and all that you can generate this energy, but what good is it if you can take it nowhere?
We can transport and generate the energy, but what happens if we aren't using it all? Apprentice I propose that we create an ojbect to store this energy!

Sometimes just having a standard array of items to decorate your cave with simply won't do, why not upgrade? 

§4Information: 
Chisel is a stand alone mod and this is virtually the only "Item" introduced by the mod. It is intended to help the player develop a wide range to make the aesthetic more enjoyable.
Using natural magics I believe we may be able to infuse living rock with the properties of the things around it, let us expiriment!
It's time to take it for a spin, point a mana spreader at it, or simply put it next to a mana pool, both will work.
The earth offers us a great many things, perhaps we can harness that power...
There is no greater power then the raw essance of mana itself, I believe by making use of this in... a new and adventerous way we can empower our enchanting

betterquesting:10.name:8: The Steel nerve of the world
betterquesting:10.desc:8: By infusing a mana diamond, mana pearl, and manasteel with... even more  mana (and I do mean a LOT more) we can make a powerful metal
Dialing into another world can be difficult, we're going to need a bit of a focus...
You have all the components required! Dial the gate and throw your book in once the Pylons are in place

In order to work with the materials of the earth, we're going to need a meterial that can withstand the heat. Use a mixture of clay and sand in order to make something that when exposed to heat doesn't need to get out of the kitchen.
At the very center of the world, just as you come upon bedrock, that is where we must start, construct and ember bore...
What good is making all these wonderful things if you don't have a way to move them around? Well I'm here to tell you it's not such a bad process
By feeding your ember bore some kind of fuel (Coal or the like) and then pumping out the results you are bound to find the true key to all of this
In order to know WHERE to drill, it is perhaps best to have a device to help us. Create a gauge!
Water, Heat, and Embers, all in the right little boiler and it's the perfect recipie to turn it into a powerful form of energetic power
You may find it's hard to get your pressure refinery working by just dumping water in there, perhaps if you had a way to pump the water in?
Now you've got embers being made in your pressure refinery right? Well how are you going to use it if they're all stuck in there?
Having power is great, but sometimes you don't need all of it, it'd be nice to have a spot to store it no?
One of the most obvious uses for this new fuel would be to make use of it to melt down metals... but to do that we're going to need something.
Well you have it in a fluid form, but what good will that do you hmm? You're going to need to let it harden and shape it!
You may have noticed that a fair number of things don't just require bars yeah? Wouldn't it be nice if that was an easier process?

A single metal is good, but infused with the power of ember, perhaps we can come up with something better. Of course we're going to need two melters to feed this device, and we're going to still need to pump it into a stamper.
Well it seems it's times for a new begginnig in metal. By mixing copper and gold we can create a brand new material, the ember infusion is key!
Sometimes storage can be a bit of a pain and ugly to look at to boot, perhaps we can find a way to store piles of a given object? Maybe even placing it under the stamper?

betterquesting:10.name:8: Wait... we use this in pipes?
betterquesting:10.desc:8: Much like it's use in electricy, copper has quite the use in conducting heat, find some and smelt it up for me
Listen we all know that there are times that it can be difficult to be a chef, maybe if we had... an even better cookbook?
Well now that you have a book, it's probably best to actually make use of it no? It's time to build a GRAND kitchen!
Alright let's admit, there is a LOT of food in the world. Sometimes it can admittedly be a bit tough to find a place to put it all..
Home cooking just isn't the same without a bit of cooking am I right? Well fire up that oven because we've got some meals to make
What is a good recipie without a bit of milk? The answer is of course not a good recipie at all, so best to make yourself a milk jar
Alright... so having milk is great and all, but who wants to constantly go milk a cow? Quick... drop an anvil on your good cow bessie while she's over the jar.
Sometimes you just want some cinnamon toast with a bit of butter, sugar, and raisens. If you don't have toast though how are you going to make it?
We can... perhaps upgrade your storage , make it a bit useful for some things... I have an idea!
Why use coal to cook your food when you can use something more... even handed?
The key to finding "An End" is first realizing there is no real end, but more then that it's combining the power of two of the more powerful creatures in the world.
Listen, there is no greater joy in the world then storing 5000 cobblestone in a single chest, but how does one do it? They key is storage upgradesx!

Remember apprentice, time and space are simply illusions, and we can abuse this to move items from one location to another with ease. It's time to tap into that power! 

§4Information: 
Ender Storage is a simple mod that makes use of the Ender Pearls and Blaze rods to make yourself a small chest. Using dye you can set the chest to various "Channels" (Meaning with 16 Colors and 3 selectors you can have a total of 4096 channels, interesting right?)
In some other lands such a tool would require little, but in a land so seeped in magic, this tool requires a great deal of magical energy
Using the knife you should be able to turn even an ordinary log into an extrodinary one by simply using your skills!
Alright so now you have some totems, I hope, those are quite the useful item aren't they? Well it's time to invest in a bit more
Look at this fancy thing! It's a way to play a few songs that's what it is! You've got to have that melody
It's time to shake your booty but why do that if you don't have the right tools?
There are cows... and then there are COWS, use a ritual to turn one of your cows into something more!
Using the magic of the dance, it's upon you to transform a tree into something moree!
Taking a totem on the go is more then useful don't you agree, using the items you've transformed you might just be able to
Now that you have some more advanced items with which to craft your musical intrustments! That's right buddy it's time to make some fancy instruments.
I bet if you could find a parrot and sing it a pretty song it might just turn into something even more interesting!
A nifty tool to make the tree a bit prettier, give it a shot!
Court death and you will find what you seek.

Listen, you're not going to make it very far in this world if you don't at least know how to farm! So we're going to start walking you through the process of starting your very own farm!

§4Information: 
This quest is to introduce you to the core concepts of a mod called Animania which will focus on a variety of factors including raising animals. This is the starting quest for that quest chain.

Animals are at the foundation of a modern society, but to work with them, you're going to need a bit more information on them! So it's time to create yourself a bit of a guide to working with them! 

§4Information
This quest is to help you craft the guide for the animania mod. This is an in game manual that will helpfully let you learn more about each of the individual aspects of the mod itself. It should cover the animals it introduces as well as how to interact, breed, etc.

Alright, well now that you're starting to make yourself a bit more of an agreian society, it's time to start working on what makes all great civilizations! That of course is the cultivation of animals. 

§4Information: 
The nest is one of the required items that will help you when it comes to chickens or peacocks or other avian type creatures in Animania, as it turns out it will also be an ingredient in making the book later on!

Patch 0.3.4 
---- 
This is a small patch meant to address issues discovered on the PTR

### Mods Updated
	
_Core_

	- Bewitchment
	
### Configuration
	- Mystical World asked to stop making quartz
	- Silk Worms no longer Territorial 
	- Silk worms don't drop from leaves nearly as often
	
### Quests
	- A lot of the early game quest have been fixed to be retrieval rather then crafting
	- Stovetop is best, reward fixed
	- Mix it up, Fixed 
	- Rare Earth Metals now ask for the correct amethyst 
	- A number of quest were made retrieval rather then crafting
	- The snooper booper removed
	- Mystical world no longer makes frogs (let quark handle them) or owls (let bewitchment handle them) 
	
### Scripting
	- Runic Shears can now properly shear Animania Horses
	- Witchery asked not to add it's other gems to the loot table

There lies a magic in these forest deeper and more powerful then even the most determined thaumaterge. Like the natrual magics of botania or the powerful wizardy of Thaumcraft, it takes upon the living essance of the world aroudn it

§4Information: 
This is a quest to complete the novel required for a mod known as Nature's Aura. This is like Thaumcraft and Botania in many ways with various aura's and baubles.

In a world with so much knowledge, sometimes it's simply too much! This is why we are offering you the chance to carry everything in one hady book

§4Information: 
To add a book to the tome, simply place it on a crafting bench with the tome. If you wish to select a book simply right click. Note everything about the book (including NBT Tags) will be retained. To switch back to the tome simply left click

Natural maintanence some may call it, and others... well lets just say they like a prettier yard! but it all begins with the first step. 

§4§5§4Information: 
This material can be right clicked onto the leaves of a given tree. Over time the tree's leaves will slowly change color to a more golden hue. When punched these leaves will have a chance to drop a new material explored in the next quest.

Do you see that my young apprentice! one of the trees that you tended to in the garden is starting to mutate! You should examine it and see just what is happening!

§4Information
These golden leaves are part of the core of Nature's Aura, these will help with a number of rituals going forward and shouldn't be tossed away casually!

It seems that if you grind up those leaves you're bound to get something a bit... interesting from them! Quickly my apprentice tell me what you have found! 

§4Information: 
The leaves can be ground into a powder, this powder is used in a manner not unlike redstone and is used as a sort of marker in a number of rituals.

So regular bottles are nice, but I have a feeling that the natural world may require a more... delicate hand!

§4Information: 
Introduced in beta Version 4, these bottles are replacements for the normal bottles which before you could just click in the air to bottle sunlight. Now you simply need to craft these.

At the core of these natural rituals is the Ritual of the Forest! But to do that you're going to need something to help 

§4Information: 
The ritual of the forest and it's components can be seen in your guide book. Keep in mind there is an option to visualize the ritual if you need to. This will be used frequently going forward.

betterquesting:10.name:8: See your world through my eyes!
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Apprentice, it is key that you begin down your path knowing your surroundings. If you continue to simply stumble around blind you will learn nothing from all of this! 

§4Information: 
Much like thaumcraft, the underlying principal that governs all of Nature's aura is the concept that each individual chunk is assigned a given value in terms of "Natural Aura" this bauble will let you see that

So you've probably noticed by now that the further you encroach upon nature the more it degrades. This is simply no good at all, and to combat it we must summon forth some of the oldest and most powerful trees in the land 

§4Information
These trees will act as the first line of defense in restoring aura to a given area. They aren't perfect but they will certainly provide some assistance.

Apprentice! A ritual of the forest is interesting, but both you and I know that there are far more powerful forces in the world right? Well it's time to put that all to the test!

§4Information: 
This is the next level alter, and is also a multi block sturcutre, but it's going to be required in order to develop a lot of Nature's Aura's more advanced objects.

What is the point of learning so much about nature if you can't get anything back from it all apprentice! Well this is your chance to really get a chance to make use of that!

§4Information: 
Much like almost any mod on the planet, Nature's Aura has it's own metal and in this case it's infused metal. Like any other metal it can be used for tools but not armor (We'll cover that more in another quest).

Apprentice, did you think to create such wonderful metals and not even believe they might be of some use to you? Don't be so foolish! Like every other metal in the world you should craft this into something worthwhile

§4Information: 
The tools are a bit unique in that each one of them has their own little ability (For instance the shovel can place grass anywhere [handy hm?]) It's a good chance to expiriment. The method for triggering each tools ability is listed in the guide book.

This one is less then simple, once you have opened a portal to the land of the Dragon you must also collect essance from that same spot. Good luck my apprentice

§4Information: 
Much like the nether and the overworld, using a Stopper and bottle in the end will result in a material that's required for a number of later game crafting recipies.

The nether is quite the haunting place wouldn't you say? Listen I'm just saying you should bottle up some of it's essance

§4Information: 
Much like the overworld, using a bottle and stopper in the nether will also result in gathering a sort of essance that is needed in crafting! Check it out

Yes apprentice, I know very well that it looks like a bird bath, but what proof do you have that the gods aren't simply large avian creatures? Well that's right you don't so build the structure

§4Information: 
A lot of the more complicated items are locked behind this particular item set. Keep in mind that you're going to need a LOT of flowers for the actual multiblock structure so get picking.

Alright Apprentice it's time to make use of that bird--- I mean alter you made. Quickly gather the required materials and make up an offering, with that we can truely unlock the unfathomable power of nature

§3§4Information: 
The Offering's purpose is basically only for the creation of the second tier of metal within Nature's Aura and it's the first thing to require you to go to the end to get the material, so you can assume the resulting materials are well wroth your weight.

Apprentice! I have reason to believe that if you combine the infused metal with the offering that you have given it's possible to create an even more powerful substance with the  very power of nature at it's core! you should definately give it a look

Everyone loves a rock concert apprentice, but do you also like rock that has been infused with the power of nature itself? The answer is of course yes, yes you do, so get on it!

§4Information: 
Not to unlike livingrock or livingstone for Botania, this is used in a number of rituals in order to help create various later game items, also it looks nice.

Using your newfound powers you may call upon the ultimate power of Nature's aura and supress the spawning of the demons which haunt this world!

§4Information:
Like the book says, this will stop monster spawns in almost a 48 block radius at the cost of some of your natural aura. A very nifty tool indeed. The only trick is to remember the radius is directly proportional to the redstone signal applied.

Fullnature Alchemist, I mean... apprentice you should really check out the power of this rock. You can transform all manner of things

§4§4Information: 
Much like botania's alchemical catalyst, this will also offer you the means to transform various objects. It certainly has the potential to fill in some areas that may be more difficult to get.

Who like using coal apprentice? The answer is of course no one, no one likes using coal, and honestly who can blame them? 

§4Information: 
This tool will allow you to draw on the natural aura surrounding you in order to booste your output of burning things. Keep in mind though that furnances by their very nature drain the surrounding area, so try to keep a balance hmm?

Apprentice do you use potions? I certainly don't use potions, but it seems that the world just can't exist unless we take a look at them. Supposedly this creation can convert the raw energy of a lingering potion directly into a powerful effect. 

§4Information: 
This will convert a LINGERING potion into natural aura. Keep in mind that there is a way to use this mod to get more lingering potions so it's not as difficult to obtain (no mudering a dragon).

The following are simply a set of Handy Keybinds you should be aware of that come default with the pack (you can of course change these as you see fit 

j - Opens Journeymap 
b - sets a waypoint in Journeymap 
~ - Opens this quest log no matter where you are
Middle Click - While in inventory this will sort your inventory 
r - This will also sort your inventory, when you are hovering over an item it will tell you the item's recipie 
Shift Clicking the + sign in any JEI recipie will attempt to place as many mats as you have available to craft as many of the item as you can. 
Each mod may have it's own keybindings so be aware of that as well.

Bee's are a very popular species for a number of reasons, but perhaps one that they are most well known for apprentice is stinging... no wait that's not it, it's honey, that's right! 

§4Information: 
This object will slowly generate honey (like that used by rustic) and has a lovely little animation. It's provided by the Animania mod but it's recipie has been altered to help keep the number of bee hives in the world to a minimum.

Sometimes you just want to carry around a lot of storage on you, and truely what better way to do so then to tear a hole in space and time itself. Well now's your chance to show the other mages you truely can go anywhere and store anything

§4Information: 
Much like the Ender chest in the prior quest, this too can make use of various dyes to set the channel. The big advantage here is that the item also acts as a backpack

Moss is the key to the decay of the world, and in it lies a rich magic. 

§4Information: 
Using the provided moss stone from the last quest, you can use your knife to scrape a bit of moss off the moss stone in front of you!

Using the moss you have gathered my young apprentice you may start to realize that there are magics to be had. Quickly construct a small ritual out of logs, root, and moss and you will see what lay before you
§4
Information: 
Using the moss and the Wildroot you can craft a pyre. Lighting it with the flint and steel, and dousing it with a bucket of water, this is the start of a number of key rituals

The humble Auberdine seed, you have likely seen it while trying to gather the wildroot. It too offers a number of humble and helpful properties. 

§4§4Information: 
Just like any number of seeds the Auberdine can be grown into a loveable edible plant.

Sometimes you are hungry and it can be hard to find food nearby. But did you know that the seeds of the world are packed full of valuable nutrients? Well it's time to get to chomping! 

§4Information: 
Mix up any seed for a quick and edible treat

At the heard of any good wizard is a wizard staff am I right? Well the same very much goes for a druid. You need a good druidic staff to do ~druidy things

§4Information:
The staff on it's own is rather useless, but you can infuse it with magical powers and watch it grow into something more.

You will find in just about any magical world that there will always be the need to extract the pure elements of magic or mana or what have you

§4Information
The mortar and pestal are used to gather a number of items that are key for making spells.

Everyone loves flowers, and as you have learned from other schools of magic, flowers can be rather potent for expanding your influence over the magical world

§4Information
Use the mortar and Pestle in order to grind up flowers into petals it will become inmportant in a moment.

Grinding a number of various things together can create TRUELY powerful magics. 

§4Information
A door, a bit of moss, some wildwood, petals, and you're ready to make yourself a supplicant powder that can help summon the fey, which who doesn't love that?

What good is spell powder and a staff if you can't make use of them? Not much good that's what it isn't! 

§4Information: 
To imbue the staff, place it on the imbuner and then place the powder under it. Then WAIT until the staff pops off, it should look a bit different.

The power of the fae is not to be trifled with. Step lightly because we are starting to tamper with their realm my young apprentice! 

§4Information: 
Crafting this is fairly straight forward. To make use of the device you must be sure to imbue it with the spell we worked on earlier. The rituals are activated with a ritual knife

Much like the moss, there are a number of other key ingredients that you should be aware of! The most obvious of which is bark. 

§4Information: 
Much like the moss, simply right click a tree with your knife and be aware that these can be used for ingredients

Said to be rarer then diamonds, these tiny little rocks are well worth your time to find. Dig about in the world and see if you can't unearth one of these rare gems

§4Information: 
This is a lovely little rare earth metal that can be helpful for crafting more druidy things.

Understanding the rituals that are before you are key. They are wonderful little things aren't they? Well lets use that first ritual to make something useful shall we? 

§4Information: 
To perform this ritual, simply have at least one obelisk that has been "supplicated" put the 5 required ingredients in and boom right click with a knife. It's that simple. You can also craft more then one at a time.

Another simple ritual, this involves mixing some dirt, magical roots, and a hint of gravel to build up some worthwhile dirt

§4Information: 
This is another simple ritual to help you get started down the path.

There's more then just magical soil... there's also soil that's been influenced by the elements

§4Information: 
So you may wish to read up on each soil by selecting the "R" key over them and selecting the information tab to figure out how to make them.

These ritualstones can have powerful influences on the plants around them. Try making use of them to craft something further. §4

Information:
These stones are fairly interesting in that they will stop animals from trampling crops AND will water crops the same distance as water, making them great for farms.

There are a number of flowers for which we must bargain with the world of magic in order to obtain. I suppose it's time to teach you that world. 

§3§4Information: 
So this is where you are actually going to use the Pyre. You can use the "U" Key while hovering over the Pyre and select the "Pyre Crafting Recipies" in order to get an idea on how to craft each of these.

The fae world truely has much to offer, and in this regard there is the wonderful power of tools which can even repair themselves given enough time. 

§4Information: 
This is fairly simple, make use of the Fae crafter in order to create yourself a simple living tool.

Not all shears are useless, some are gifted with magical powers that can extract from them the very essance of things you might not expect. 

§4Information: 
These shears can help you gather a number of items for roots.

Plants are not the only items that tend to shed more magical things when they are sheared. Try animals as well
§4
Information: 
Deer, Sheep, give it a shot and sheer a few animals to get a bit of leather.

Using your shears apprenctice,  go about finding some of the "rarer" seeds and items

§3§4Information: 
Using the shears on beetroots and wheat should reward you with  these items.

This powerful leather has an interesting side effect and it is best to craft it into some armor. 

§4Information: 
Using the Fae crafter and some armor you can make use of an interesting set of armor for yourself.

The wildwood once flourished across this land my apprentice, but no longer. As the world was left abandoned to the restless undead these once powerful trees vanished

§4Information: 
You must make use of the Wildwood growth ritual, this should produce a single tree.

Now that you have access to mana, try throwing a book in there and see what you get

§4Information: To get the Wizardry book you must LITERALLY throw a book into a mana pool. You can also throw wood to instantly transmute it to wisdom wood

The wildwood is a powerful thing, and when combined with other items can offer you powerful protection

§4Information: 
Use the fae crafter to create yourself a piece of armor. You'll find it has a few special properties.

Listen, the truth of minecraft is that not much of anything is getting done without a bucket, and the same is true here. So the name of the game is to use some of that new found iron to make a bucket.

There are rumors that sprinkled throughout the world is the power of magic in it's most raw form, Mana. Collect a portion of this power 

§4Information:  This is the starter quest for the mod known as wizardry

There comes a mystical magic dependent on nature, but which taps into the darkness of the natural world. In the old days for every wizard there was a witch, and if you wish to become a true ruler of magic you must know of them as well. 

Forage for some time until you come across a Mandrake Seed

§4Information: This is the starter quest for the mod bewitchment. This mod will have you punching grass and looking for seeds

Unlike the child stories of old, witches are no force to be trifled or toyed with. They have a deep, powerful, and dark ancient magic to them! Be careful where you step 

§4Information: This book will begin you on your quest to better understanding Bewitchment.
There is another rare earth metal that you will find quite commonly across the world and it needs to be used in any number of task. Smelt some gold down.

Sometimes trying to sort things by hand can grow cumbersome and tiring, so why not allow magic to do the work for you? 

§4Information: This is the starer quest for the mod "Arcane Archives" which acts as a magical storage mod.

The table that you have planted apprentice, do you hear it... humming? Well that is because this lovely little table just likes to grow from the very area around it

§4Information: 
The table will grow crystals on a regular basis. You harvest these crystals by breaking them. You may have at maximum 3 tables. The crystals act as the key resource for the remainder of the mod.

My apprentice, it seems the power of this alter simply isn't enough, we are going to need more in order to create even more, powerful items! Prepare the correct structure and then begin construction on the alter. 

§4Information: It is worth noting that most everything in Astral Sorcery has a structure that goes with it (Alters / Rituals / etc). Meaning these are multi block structuresd often 11x11x7 or more in size.  Consult the book for the exact structure details.

My young apprentice, to truely gaze into the stars, you are going to need to sharpen your vision, and to do that I believe we can use the  very magic of the stars. Place some glass and aquamarines on your new crafting table. 

§4Information: These piece of starlight infused glass will be used in any number of future expiriments and items so you may wish to make a few of them just in case.

I don't think that our current altar has enough power... enough room to truely construct all that the stars have to offer. 

§4Information: This is your next stage. Keep in mind: Don't change the structure under the altar until you've upgraded it. This will unlock new sections in your Astral Sorcery book as well. Plus it looks really cool

My apprentice, are you ready to progress to the next stage? Well if so it's time to learn! Prepare yourself, you are going to need to construct a method to link the power of the collector crystals to objects around them

§4Information: You're going to want to find one of the temples with a collector crystal inside. You can right click a block and then the crystal with this tool to link them. Some blocks may change (like Iron for instance).

Hmm... perhaps if we use the power of the Collector Crystall.. Yes yes I believe that will do it. Quickly! Grab your tools and place some iron ore near the crystal my young apprentice, I have a rather... brilliant idea

§4Information: By linking Iron ore with the power of a collector crystal you can create a material known as star metal which is used in a number of recipies.

betterquesting:10.name:8: You know what grinds my gears?
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
I do believe that there may yet be a purpose for all of this... rock we've been toying with. I can't quite put my finger on it, but I think you should go about creating one of those wheels

§4Information: Despite being from the previous chapter of the mod, the grinding wheel's purpose doesn't really come into focus (for Astral Sorcery at least) until the later stages. Still you can make one to grind down metal which is always handy

What about this my young apprentice? We can perhaps grind the star metal? By doing so we may be able to create some rather interesting effects don't you think? 

§4Information: Like starmetal, stardust is also used extensively as an ingredient for a number of future items throughout the rest of the mod, so you may wish to keep some handy.

My apprentice, it has come to my attention that simply gazing into the stars like some kind of citrus deprived sailor is going to do you no good at all! It's time to go further! Put a tripod on that thing! 

§5§4Information: You will learn as you progress further through Astral Sorcery that there are smaller and smaller constellations. Keep finding constellation papers throughout the world to learn about them and their effects.

betterquesting:10.name:8: LFM Molten Core, Must be attuned
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Studying the ancient text, I believe there may be hope yet to convert the power of certain star patterns into something more. Quickly follow me and I shall show you what I mean

§4Information: IMPORTANT, this also follows on the constellations that you've been uncovering with the telescope. Each constellation has it's own effects (enchantments / potions / armor / etc.),  so be sure to read up on each of them. Note that once something is attuned by and large it is difficult to get the materals (or impossible) to unattune them. So choose wisely.

I... I have an idea my apprentice. We can attune more then just your body to the constellations of the sky, perhaps we can attune the rock crystals as well! Here let me find one in my bag

§4Information: Crystals can be attuned and then placed on a ritual pedestal (which has a structure). The effects are determined on a variety of factors including the Purity and Size of the Crystal, what type of crystal it is (celestial or normal). And of course the constellation being attuned to.

We must take yet one more step in order to achieve that which we truely seek, the unlimited power of the stars. To do so we must agument our altar just a bit more, a place to focus the celestiial strength it has gathered. 

§4§4Information: At current, this is the final form of the celestial altar, and for certain recipies it must be attuned to match a given star pattern. Keep this in mind

My apprentice... I believe I have found a way to strengthen your alter! Even if you don't have the full power of the stars to guide it. This power comes through focusing starlight through the use of spectral relays 

§4Information: There is a recipie in the book to make a relay and they serve a number of purposes. The first and most obvious is to strengthen the alter. Note the Astral Sorcery guide will provide additional details (as there must be a structure underneath the relay). 

You can use up to 4 to strengthen the alter, but note they must be able to see the night sky like the alter They will also need some distance between them.

Hm...  perhaps there is a way to use the powers contained within the starlight liquid with any number of items? But we're going to need something more, some manner of infusion structure for doing so. 

§4Information: The infusion alter's primary purpose tends to be for infusing aquamarines. Keep in mind that this has to have all 12 starlight liquid segments filled in order to function. 

Oh... it may also do some ore doubling

Its time to expiriment and make use of our structure, quickly gather up some of your starlight liquid and let's use this infusion altar for something useful 

§4Information: Dirt -> Grass, Sand -> Clay, be sure to check out all the possible recipies. This item is used a great deal in all future recipies.

Hmm... this stardust has all sorts of interesting properties. Apprentice you've been trying to increase the size of your rock crystals by throwing them in Starlight Liquid right? Perhaps you can try throwing this in there with them! 

§4Information: By adding this to a rock crystal in starlight liquid, it will create a celestial crystal growth. These are larger, and more powerful. Much like Rock Crystals they can be grown in starlight liquid and once they reach maximum size they have a VERY small chance to double / split with one segment being more pure.

Perhaps we can expand the powers of the stars to help with some mundane task? Tell me  have you grown tired of chopping down trees? 

§4Information: Tree Beacons are one of those handy devices. Simply put the tree beacon down and then the saplings of the trees you wish to harvest. Given enough time the sapling will grow with exposure to the tree beacon and have a certain glow to it. From there anything that might have dropped off the tree will now occasionally just drop

I have a further idea for stabalizing our ritiuals and the like. Do you recall the crystal that you stumbled across in the temple? I believe that I may be able to recreate such  a thing. 

§4Information: Collector Crystals have a variety of purposes, from strengthening starlight to an altar, to strengthening a ritual all the way to being able to convert items (just like the orginal).

There may be items that are buried beneath the very foundations of the world itself. So cemeted in the bedrock that we will need a collasal drill to reach down into the depths. 

§4Information: Fed with liquid starlight and dumping it's contents into a chest or chalice, this device will  burrow its way down to the core of the earth (depending on which final form you give it) and start extracting materials.

Making tools is one matter, but what if we could attune a piece of armor, similar to the manner in which you have been attuned? 

§4Information: By attuning the alter a certain way you can create an armor that much like everything else that can be attuned, has certain unique properties based on what it is attuned with.

Well if Lava and Liquid Starlight mix to make sand, perhaps we can put them both in a small container. What do you think apprentice? 

§4Information: Much like their real liquid counterparts, if two containment chalices with different liquids are close enough together they will begin to make the items that would normally be formed in collisions. In addition these can automatically draw liquids from a Liquid Starlight well.

You may have noticed that the Radient crystals give off a fair amount of light. Well you may find that you can make some lovely light implements if you just go about shattering that lovely resonating crystal. 

§4Information: 
You literallly just need to hit a stone with the crystal (as in left click with the crystal in your hand and target a stone).

Ah... what a wonderful gem, but what's the point of such a wonderful gem if you can't cut it into such a perfect shape? I bet they could be incredibly useful 

§4Information: 
The gemcutting table is key to the rest of the mod. Everything in terms of crafting for the mod from this point forward is crafted in this table.

Apprentice, it is time to put that cutting table to better use! Quickly grab one of those... clunky gems and use the table to turn it into something more useful 

§4Information: 
This is simply a crafting item used by the mod. It has no use on it's own, it's simply used in other recipies.

betterquesting:10.name:8: And you said let there be light
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
You should try reinforcing your basic devices with, like the chest and crafting bench. Not only do they grow larger or more useful they might even put off light! 

§4Information: 
You can simply right click a chest or crafting table. You can also craft it normally in a crafting.

Well... I know the temptation is there, but you definately not inhale this powder. It has some rather unique properties. 

§4Information: 
This is simply a crafting ingredient used as part of the mod made via the gemcutting table.

Apprentice, what point is there in having a storage system if you can't figure out what's in it! Quickly scrap some things together. 

§4Information: 
The manifest allows the user to see anything being monitored or present in the network. In addition selecting an item will point the user in the direction of the storage it's contained within.

Dear User,

Simply insert script into table, so that script may become permanent fixture of useful system of magical pipes and tubes. Do not question the will of the prophets

§4Information: 
It does exactly what it says on the tin, allowing you a block so that you can interact with your storage network and view the contents within.

Apprentice! 

Now that we have powder and refined gems, I think it best if we begin to craft these into other items, to further extract their power

§5§4Information: 
Much like the previous quest, this also acts as simply another item within the mod for crafting future items

You know for some reason, I have the strangest hankering to contain a series of large sea creatures my young apprentice? Do you think you can help? 

§4Information
Much like the inlay, this is used as an ingredient in further crafted items.

Well you can't very well make a perfectly good storage system with a strangely shaped hexagonal shape. 

§4Information 
This is yet another crafting object for future items in the mod.

My young apprentice, what's the point of movinng storage too and fro if you can't help keep an eye on the other spots you have storage! 

§4Information: 
This crystal will allow the Arcane Archives mod to interact more properly with other similar storage mods (Non converted chest, storage drawers, etc)

It's easy enough to store physical objects, but the ability to store an entire  lake? Now that's where its at. I think we need to bestow upon you such power!

§4Information:
The tank allows you store any liquid (Liquid Starlight, Milk, Lava, Water, etc.)

I believe... that we can make liquid transportation even easier my apprentice. 

§4Information: 
You can link this item with an existing radient tank. You can then use this to draw or replace liquids that are in the tank at any range. Like you're able to carry around a bucket and radient tank all in one.

My young apprentice, I have a brilliant idea! If you infuse a brazier with this radient magic, I believe it may very well open up a tunnel! 


§4Information: 
This item is incredibly useful, throwing items into the fire will place the items into the radient network. Monitoring crystal based storage won't receieve items. In addition the range which the brazier will interact with can be configured.

By taking things to their natural extreme you can make use of the storage potential of the network.  You can get near infinite amounts of items in this thing! 

§4Information: 
If you're familiar with barrels, this might be as close as one comes to it. You can store a single item to extreme amounts.

My apprentice, I am happy to say that all of this storage can at least be examined, but to do so you're going to need that crafting table! 

§4Information: 
This is the first form of the tool that Arcane Archives uses. This can be used to help see the current status of  a given inventory (Were WAILA not present this may be useful).

My apprentice, you have overcome perhaps your greatest challenge, as such I think it time you show the world the light of your persistence. Assemble a beacon! 

§4Information: This is one of the final quest for the Vanilla minecraft chain. Please be sure to explore all the various vanilla options!

Well my young apprentice, it is time to truely harvest the power of the constellations that  you have discovered. Using this table I believe we can make enchantments and potions both! 

§4Information: This unique UI'd device, so long as it is granted access to starlight, will with the right combintation of attunements create it's very own enchantments and potions.

You should know how to live in this world by now right? Well just to be sure we're gonna go through a bit of a refresher course ok? 

§4Information: 
This chapter is largely only for two purposes. The first is to familiarize you with the way in which quest work and also to help you understand where in the overall Minecraft Tech tree each of these mods fall.
Alright so you've mastered the basics, now are you ready to move on to something even more complicated? Let's get started!
Sometimes you must take the approach of the simple life my young apprentice, and often times that means learning a bit about farming
The power of the stars is nothing to be trifled with my young apprentice,, each constellation over head is truely a marvel.
The very nature of the world is something unique my apprentice, perhaps we should begin making use of those tools.
My young apprentice there are times when magic needs a bit of aid, the machinations of the world! You must be familiar with this path as well
Sometimes we have no choice but to venture into the darkness of the world  that is darker magics, I will guide you my young apprentice.
At the very heart of this world is a power that can bend and shape energy itself, the ancients called them embers
There are powers that nature truely gifts on to use, using the powers from our other magics we might learn them!

There lies in the very heart of nature a delicate balance that must be maintained, this chapter will teach you and guide you through the process of providing balance to nature! 

§4Information: 
Nature's balance is a recently released Mod that may still be in the early beta stages, you can expect that this chapter may morph as the mod matures and develops. We urge everyone to give it a try!

My young apprentice, surely you grow weary of collecting and sorting so many items? Perhaps there is a manner by which we can ease your burden?

§4Information: Arcane Archives is a storage focused mod, in the vein of more tech centric mods like Applied Energistics or the like, with a magical twist.

Roots is a mod about discovering the natural magics of the world, poitns where the world of the Fey has blessed our own. These blessing imbune otherwise mundane plant life with the magical energies, enabling clever players to become masters of the druidic arts.
